text: some of the earliest experiments with
electricity in the body relied on eels
and others strongly electric fish but
until now how eels use their electric
discharges to hunt and kill their prey
has not been understood you'd think that
eels kill by shocking their prep sending
out big waves of electricity swapping
the systems of the small fish and
invertebrates that they eat
in fact eels hunt and kill their prey in
a very precise way their shocks are
tuned to the same frequencies as the
nerves and muscle using one kind of
pulse eels can make their prey freeze
making them easy to catch as they float
helplessly by or a hunting eel can
release pulses that cause hidden prey to
twitch involuntarily revealing their
location then the eel can paralyze them
at a distance like a Taser one question
still remains though why don't you lose
shocks themselves
you
